Articles.Content:
As this is the anniversary of the first man to step on the moon, you are to reenact that great mission.

Make it look and work like the Apollo 11 spacecraft, it must have 3 crew 2 must land (in a pod no external seats), then re dock in orbit and return home.

Rules. informational and visual mods are ok for stock, no cheats, keep clipping to a minimum,for hard and Manley mode no solar panels (they used Fuel Cells for power), and have fun.

Normal, Just do the mission

Hard+5 Cookie points, No reaction Wheels(includes the reaction Wheels in pods) use rcs to turn like the real one, and have a free return trajectory till in the SOI of the mun 

Manley mode+10 Cookie points, Do Hard bring a rover and no stability assist or sas Holds

:cool:Cookie points for cool picks and being like the real one. 

Cookie points are by vote for picks.

leader boards

1. [ekulsseh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/145207-ekulsseh) Manley mode+10 Cookie points

2. [MERTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/131441-MERTI) Normal? 1 Cookie point

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-21T19:46:40Z" title="07/21/2015 07:46  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 21, 2015</time> by ekulsseh**
Only one problem; Apollo 11 didn't have a rover.

I have used one modded part, the Alcor lander capsule, simply because it looks so much better than the stock 2-man lander can. Hope that's ok, as everything else is completely stock.

On the pad, ready to go

![Ap1101.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1101.jpg)

1st stage separation

![Ap1102.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1102.jpg)

Extracting the LEM

![Ap1103.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1103.jpg)

LEM separates from the CSM in Munar orbit

![Ap1104.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1104.jpg)

Paying respects on the surface

![Ap1105.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1105.jpg)

Time to leave

![Ap1106.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1106.jpg)

Lander module back with the CSM

![Ap1107.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1107.jpg)

Just before splashdown at dusk

![Ap1108.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/Ap1108.jpg)

Um, have you seen gregroxmun's aap challenge thread?[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121201-The-Apollo-Applications-Program-1-0-Edition](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121201-The-Apollo-Applications-Program-1-0-Edition)

I and a few others have done Apollo 11 and then some.
Yep I looked at it, but just found it too confusing/time consuming trying to read through all the stages/craft/requirements and just gave up reading the initial post after the first few paragraphs.

Here's my entry. My first video too. Enjoy!
